comments.text:
KWin is KDE's window manager. The KWin developers are designing a new 'Exposed Tabs' extension, consisting in two new properties:

* _KDE_NET_WM_EXPOSED_TABS
* _KDE_NET_WM_CURRENT_EXPOSED_TAB

More details at http://community.kde.org/KWin/Browser_Integration

We should use that to expose our tabs in the same way that we already do on Windows 7.

I'm OK to help with that, if someone can please just point me at the right place in our code (where is the Windows 7 implementation?)

KWin is KDE's window manager. The KWin developers are designing a new 'Exposed Tabs' extension, consisting in two new properties:

* _KDE_NET_WM_EXPOSED_TABS
* _KDE_NET_WM_CURRENT_EXPOSED_TAB

More details at http://community.kde.org/KWin/Browser_Integration

We should use that to expose our tabs in the same way that we already do on Windows 7.

I'm OK to help with that, if someone can please just point me at the right place in our code (where is the Windows 7 implementation?)
